title: South Africa bowler Rabada serving ban for positive drug test
byline: South African fast bowler Kagiso Rabada revealed on Saturday that he was serving a ban from cricket for recreational drug use.

title: Man killed, another injured in Meetiyagoda shooting
byline: A 47-year-old man was killed and another injured in a shooting incident in Meetiyagoda, police said.

title: President says stopping buses on expressway wrong; mulls disciplinary action
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake criticized the incident where buses heading to Colombo for the NPP May Day rally were parked along the Southern Expressway and stressed the need to take disciplinary action against those responsible.

title: Main suspect in Club Wasantha murder brought to Sri Lanka
byline: Sujeewa Ruwan Kumara de Silva, alias ’’Loku Patty’’, the main suspect in the Club Wasantha murder and a known organized criminal, has been brought back to Sri Lanka.

title: Trump criticised after posting AI image of himself as Pope
byline: US President Donald Trump has attracted criticism from some Catholics after posting an AI-generated image of himself as the Pope.

title: Japanese Defence Minister meets Prime Minister Harini to bolster bilateral ties
byline: Japanese Defence Minister Gen. Nakatani paid a courtesy call on Sri Lankan Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya at Temple Trees today, with discussions focused on strengthening bilateral cooperation in defense and regional security.

title: No data access in Starlink deal raises security concerns: President
byline: There is a weakness in the initial agreement we made with Starlink, as it does not grant us access to its data systems in the event of a national security issue, unlike the arrangements we have with existing telecom providers in Sri Lanka, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said.

title: Acting ministers appointed during President’s absence
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Acting Ministers for four ministries while he is away on an official visit to Vietnam.

title: Houthi missile hits near Israel’s main airport
byline: A missile fired from Yemen landed near the main terminal of Israel’s Ben Gurion airport on Sunday morning, Israeli authorities said.

title: LG polls candidate injured in Kalutara shooting
byline: A candidate contesting the upcoming local government election was injured in a shooting incident in Kalutara, police said.

title: Fake branding on canned fish uncovered during raid in Negombo
byline: Following a complaint received by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA), a warehouse in Negombo was raided, where a stock of canned fish intended for market distribution was found to be misleadingly labeled with the name and standard logo of a manufacturing company.

title: Maldives president holds record 15-hour press conference
byline: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu addressed a press conference for nearly 15 hours, his office said on Sunday, claiming it broke a previous record held by Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Air India suspends flights to Tel Aviv to May 6 after airport attack
byline: Air India said on Sunday it had suspended flights to Tel Aviv until May 6 after a missile attack on Israel’s main international airport.

title: Sri Lanka women outclass India in tri-series thriller
byline: On the back of a disciplined bowling performance and a calculative chase, Sri Lanka Women outclassed India Women by 3 wickets in the Fourth ODI of the ongoing Tri-Series in Colombo, Sri Lanka. With two back to back wins, the Lankans now stand strong in the race for a spot in the final of the Tri Series next Sunday..

title: LG polls candidate arrested for raping underage girl
byline: A candidate who is contesting the Local Government elections was arrested for raping an underage girl in Passara.

title: Jewels linked to Buddha remains go to auction, sparking ethical debate
byline: On Wednesday, a cache of dazzling jewels linked to the Buddha’s mortal remains, which have been hailed as one of the most astonishing archaeological finds of the modern era, will go under the hammer at Sotheby’s in Hong Kong.

title: Trump says he is not considering running for third term
byline: US President Donald Trump has denied that he is considering running for a third presidential term, a move which experts agree is banned under the US Constitution.
